1.content:
Coona and her friends emerged from the woods, exhausted and confused. Like the proverbial lost walking around in circles, the girls had stumbled blindly in the darkness of the previous night in search of their village.

Finding themselves in a clearing with fences and signposts that spurted from the ground like weeds, a feeling of deja-vu hovered over them like a thick fog until they realized, they had passed upon this place before.

This clearing, devoid of citizens, livestock and houses (including similar dwellings such as dog houses and chicken coops) was all that remained of the girls' bustling community. Where homes once stood, a patchwork of flat geometric patterns of every size and deformation meandered across the landscape. This image seemingly projected an optical illusion that refused to go away by casually altering one's perception with a blink or a shift in the stance.

Hazzoos, a teenage boy who had grown up alongside the girls, had fallen asleep outdoors, still unaware that the world around him had changed. Leanna found him slumbering on top of a pile of dry crinkly leaves hidden beneath an old oak's voluminous shade. Gently, she tapped his shoulder and beseechingly whispered his name until he opened a pair of crusty eyes.

Meanwhile, Coona picked out the clear spot where her nuptial home to be would have been had the wedding celebrations concluded as expected. Shaken by the lack of resistance that her mind and body half expected, the unconsummated bride walked through areas where brick walls once stood and fell to the ground heaving and wailing. Drawn by her unrelenting cries, Fashi -- a large black dog -- approached to whimper her sympathy.
1.title: Every house is gone

11.content:
Hazzoos found it hard to actually walk across the bare spots on the ground where the buildings once stood. So accustomed to walking along the roads and pathways, he willed himself to take a step into the square where his brother's home once lay.

He had no words to describe his feelings as he criss crossed the hole in the ground, only more questions.

Hagly, his favorite dog, strode up to his side. She didn't seem to mind the empty vastness that he found so disturbing.

As she rubbed her face into his thigh, it occurred to him that she was begging for food.

"I'm sorry, girl, but I don't have anything to give you."
11.title: Look for more survivors

111.content:
The three teenagers, accompanied by their two dogs decided to head to the farm, or at least what was left of it.

"We should find something to eat." Hazzoos said to the other two girls. The two girls nodded in agreement. They all rumaged around the farmland and found tidbits of crops, and Hagly was lucky enough to find a dead chicken in the coop for them all to share. Although the portions were small, they didn`t complain, nor did they speak about anything at all the whole meal.

Afterwards they decided to...
111.title: Looking for food

112.content:
Hagly lifted her soft brown gaze to Hazzoos' and sighed.

She could sense the negative mood that wrapped around the man.

'Come on,' she mimed. 'Let's fill our bellies with something delicious!'

But the man looked sadly back at her. The sight almost made her cringe.

"I'm sorry but I have no food to give you," he said.

'That's okay. I know some good places to hunt. Come on, let's go!'

He stroked the top of her head and cupped her jowls. Hagly pulled her head away from the uncomfortable embrace.

'The prey is waiting. Please come with me,' she pleaded.
112.title: Hagly wants to eat

choices: Build the shrine with Beth and Solaris
12.content:
Leanna put her arms around Coona's heaving shoulders as gently as she could and cried with her friend.

Beth and Solaris screamed and called for their loved ones too and failing to get an answer, they quickly built a shrine.

"What are you doing?" Leanna demanded. She had an inkling of what they were up to.

"My family is gone now," Beth said.

"And so is mine," Solaris said.

"It's time to bury the dead and move on."

Leanna was still in shock. "How can you be sure?" she asked. "Where is the proof?"

"Don't you see, there's nobody here except us," Beth said as she pointed at nothing.

"There may be others. We were lost in the woods until morning. Don't you think we should let them return before lighting a fire for them." To make the shrine holy, the builders would have to leave the site once the pyre was lit. Leanna was mortified that she would have to leave so soon.

"You don't have to be a part of this," Beth explained. "If you want to stay, we won't stop you."

Leanna gazed at Coona's huddled frame on the floor. If Beth and Solaris left together, Coona would want to go as well. 'Would Coona wait with her if given the chance?'
12.title: Leave the village

123.content:
Flandris, a raven haired pixie, perched on the tip of a branch overlooking the village. He could see the vast wasteland that resulted from Imra's foul magic.

'Very, very bad,' he thought to himself. It was too late to report to his master. There was nothing he or the other Gods could do now. So Flandris sat, anxiously, to see what might happen next.

In the distance, the young man called Hazzoos was talking to his dog. Two of the girls were building a small holy shrine. At the outskirts of the village border, a pack of dogs howled for lost companions.

Flandris' slight figure trembled as a breeze blew past his leaf. Like a shadowy laugh, the sound echoed across the leaves, sending goosebumps up and down his spine.

Invisible but not undetectable, Flandris fled. With a leap to the nearest slip wind, he glided to a nearby tree.
123.title: Flandris watches over the village

13.content:
Her house had become a cage. Desperately, Sasha tried to leave the house but all attempts failed. Something was holding her inside.

It was strange how everything inside her home looked so familiar yet gave her so much consternation. Beyond the doorway spread a darkness that she was not accustomed to. This was a darkness that could not be crossed. It was firm as a wall and push as she might, she could not feel anything against her skin.

Picking up her dolly, she threw it at the darkness. Her dolly bounced back just as she knew it would.
13.title: Sasha is trapped in her house

info.description: Members of a nameless group of survivors go their separate ways, intent on building new lives.
